story.author: Harry Turner
story.headline: Occupational Hypnotherapy Seeing a Surge in Popularity
story.subheading: Occupational Hypnotherapy has seen a large rise popularity, the largest since the late 1990's.

article.p: Occupational Hypnotherapy, a expirimental method of therapy to improve employee morale and efficiency, has seen a rise in popularity. The therapy was most notably popular in the late 1990's for software developers.
Practioners note that not only does the therapy improve workplace morale, it discourages employees from creating money-funneling viruses.
Since the the re-introduction of the therapy, many business have also seen a drop in mysteriously destroyed printers. Whether or not the two are related has not been determined.
